data.title: JOE MULLINS & THE RADIO RAMBLERS
data.meta_description: The  Industrial Strength Bluegrass  Festival  has once again captured the attention of the  International Bluegrass Music Association (IBMA)  with a prestigious nomination for  Event of the...
data.text:
Industrial Strength Bluegrass–2024 IBMA Nominee!

The Industrial Strength Bluegrass Festival has once again captured the attention of the International Bluegrass Music Association (IBMA) with a prestigious nomination for Event of the Year. Building on our previous success in 2022, this recognition reaffirms the festival's reputation for excellence and innovation in the industry. As we gear up for our next event, we are excited to continue showcasing top-tier bluegrass talent and providing an unforgettable experience for music enthusiasts. Tickets are available for our Fall festival scheduled for November 7th, 8th & 9th in Wilmington, OH!

Congratulations,

​Daniel Mullins!

Daniel has been recognized by the IBMA with TWO nominations for Liner Notes of the Year for his work on the latest album by Blue Highway as well as the extensive liner notes for the expanded vinyl edition of Industrial Strength Bluegrass - Southwestern Ohio's Musical Legacy.

Joe Mullins Featured on

​The Necessary ENTREPRENEUR Podcast

Smithsonian Folkways Recordings Releases

​D​ouble Vinly LP Set of

​Industrial Strength Bluegrass

Three years after its original release on compact disc and streaming services, Smithsonian Folkways is announcing a special DOUBLE VINYL LP SET of the International Bluegrass Music Association’s (IBMA) Album of the Year (2021), Industrial Strength Bluegrass. This all-star project set, which tells the story of bluegrass’ transformation from a music to a movement carried north by Appalachians seeking a better life in the booming post-WWII factories of Southwest Ohio, will be released May 3rd. The new vinyl edition includes the original 16-song collection PLUS seven bonus archival tracks. (Read More)

#1 Song Celebrated

~ ​"Black and White" ~

Our new fan favorite song, "Black and White" has also been a radio favorite and reached #1 on the National Bluegrass Survey Top 30 Songs chart in February. We were honored to have our Billy Blue Records team with us at last month's Industrial Strength Bluegrass Festival who surprised us with the presentation of a plaque commemorating the song's success.

"Black And White" is from our latest album Let Time Ride which has been on the Top 15 Albums chart for 12 consecutive months.

#1 song for JMRR!

JMRR are celebrating a #1 song with "Black And White" from their Let Time Ride album on Billy Blue Records. The song tops the National Bluegrass Survey's Top 30 Songs chart for February! Buy/Stream Let Time Ride Here!

Industrial Strength Bluegrass [CD]

$

19.95

“They are awesome!”

Pete Fisher, Former General Manager,

​Grand Ole Opry

"Joe Mullins is what could be termed a double threat in the business. Musically, he is one of the top bluegrass acts in the business along with his band, the Radio Ramblers, but he also is one of the top radio personalities in the genre. Spend any amount of time with him, and you'll be in amazement at his vocal chops -- whether singing or announcing."

Chuck Dauphin, Billboard Magazine

"Joe is a driving force in the world of bluegrass. Over the past three decades, he has devoted his life both to bluegrass performance and to disseminating great bluegrass, gospel and country music via radio. A masterful Scruggs-style banjo picker and gifted singer known for his soaring high tenor, he leads a top-notch band that can do it all, delivering impeccable instrumentals and superb harmony singing with equal ease."

National Council of Traditional Arts

"Whether it's a live performance at the Grand Ole Opry or one of the band's singles or albums being featured in a Top Ten countdown show, the Radio Ramblers have hit on just the right combination of bluegrass, traditional country, and gospel music to propel them into the top tier of today's touring bands."

Tom Adams, Banjo Newsletter

“These guys are among the elite in the business keeping the fires lit for the original bluegrass sound.”

Craig Havighurst, Music City Roots

“A second-generation ’grasser, Mullins grew up around music at its very best, and the Radio Ramblers’ take on tradition is more informed -- and therefore richer and more nuanced -- than that of many who wave the banner.”

Jon Weisberger, Nashville Scene
